intro: Acinodendron androsaemifolium, commonly known as the Andros cedar, is a member of the Burseraceae family and is native to the island of Andros in the Bahamas. It is a small, evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of about 10 meters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. Its small, fragrant flowers are yellowish-green and appear in clusters, followed by small, woody fruits. The tree is notable for its slow growth and is considered a rare and endemic species.
